name: Vinehealth
slogan: Improving quality of life and survival of cancer patients worldwide
description:
Vinehealth is a digital platform that uses a combination of behavioural science and artificial intelligence to improve the quality of life and survival of cancer patients. Through empowering cancer patients to self-manage their treatments and lifestyle, the Vinehealth platform gathers data that is crucial to improving drug development for millions of cancer patients across the world.

Get in touch if you want to play a key role in a high-impact, fast-growing startup and if you’re passionate about making a big impact.

team.title: Co-Founder & CTO
team.name: Georgina Kirby
team.bioHtml: Experienced data science and product leader with key commercial focus and a demonstrated history of working in healthcare.

team.title: Co-Founder & CTO
team.name: Georgina Kirby
team.bioHtml: Experienced data science and product leader with key commercial focus and a demonstrated history of working in healthcare.

jobs.title: Community Manager
jobs.description:
---Overview---
We’re looking for a community marketing manager to grow the Vinehealth community of charities, patients and other stakeholders.

We're looking for someone to be a real part of the team. You spend a lot of time with the people you work with, so we want it to be fun and rewarding rather than feel like a chore. That means having a passion for what we're doing, wanting to make a real difference to people's lives, having interests outside of work, sharing knowledge with your colleagues, and adding to our company culture.


---Role Description---

Community growth
- Connect, engage, and establish long-term relationships with new and existing users of our products

Social media management & PR opportunities:
- Promote awareness of Vinehealth with external stakeholders including the media, analysts, investors, customers
- Develop regular thought leadership and social media posts and identifying relevant events to attend and speaking opportunities

Organising and running external community events :
- Develop and manage a programme of in person events to connect with our users (patients/carers/charities/oncologists etc) and ensure that the users are always at the center of everything we do
- Flexibility required re evening/weekend events - time off given in lieu

Charity relationship management and running/supporting charity events:
- Create, develop and maintain relationships with charity partners
- Organise events in collaboration with charities to engage our users

Content creation:
- Create content for use across our products as applicable
- Copywrite all content
- User support and customer service

Skills
- Strong communicator
- Impeccable spelling and grammar
- Hugely empathetic towards our users
- Welcoming, personable, discrete
- Highly organised
- Problem solver
- Creative and fast-moving
- Huge attention to detail
- Curious
- Humble
- Quick to learn
- Passion for technology, startups and healthcare
- Ability to multitask
- Photoshop and video editing skills desirable but not essential
- Previous experience in healthcare or healthtech desirable but not essential


---Benefits---
- Highly competitive salary (based on experience) as well as other incentives where appropriate
- Participation in an attractive EMI share option scheme
- Pension
- 25 days holiday + bank holidays
- Extra half day off during your birthday week!
- Macbook Pro
- Learning & development expenses
- Free tea, coffee and fruit
- Beautiful 3rd floor office space in the heart of the city surrounded by lovely restaurants, bars, gyms and public transport
- Beautiful onsite break areas and regular community events
- Yoga on Fridays
